member.name: T:GrooperGit.FileManager
member.summary: A Class to maintain a file abstract of the Grooper Tree Under the git project in order to leverage GIT commands against the Grooper Nodes.
member.remarks: This is because Grooper Nodes aren't files and need to be able to detect differences as files and compare differences as files.

member.name: M:GrooperGit.FileManager.SyncProject(Grooper.GrooperNode)
member.summary: Syncs the active node settings of all children in the project and marks their appropriate GitStatus.

member.name: T:GrooperGit.GitRepository
member.summary: Git Repository

member.name: P:GrooperGit.GitRepository.localRepository
member.summary: Represents the local path of the Git repository associated with the Grooper Project.
member.remarks: The repository URL points to the location where the Git project is hosted. Developers can use this URL to clone, fetch, or push changes to the repository. It's an essential link for collaboration and code management.

member.name: P:GrooperGit.GitRepository.remoteRepository
member.summary: Represents the remote path of the Git repository associated with the Grooper Project.
member.remarks: The repository URL points to the location where the Git project is hosted. Developers can use this URL to clone, fetch, or push changes to the repository. It's an essential link for collaboration and code management.

member.name: T:GrooperGit.GitShell
member.summary: An abstract for running git CLI commmands through powershell.

member.name: M:GrooperGit.GitShell.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Contsctructor
member.param: The current working directory of the shell

member.name: T:GrooperGit.GitProject
member.summary: A Git Project is a library of resources that can be version controlled and managed by other people. It serves as the primary container in which design components are created and organized.
member.remarks: Project 'resources' are configuration objects created by a designer, which define the connections, data structures, and logic used when processing documents through Grooper.

member.name: T:GrooperGit.ConverToGitProject
member.summary: Executes a publish to git, and creates a git repository on a Project [Object Command].
member.remarks: Transforms the node type from Project to GitProject, and begins a repository connection. More info.

member.name: M:GrooperGit.ConverToGitProject.Execute(Grooper.Project)
member.summary: Code that will be executed when the [Object Command] is executed.
member.param: The Grooper object that the command will execute against.

member.name: T:GrooperGit.GitCommand
member.summary: Template for a custom [Object Command].
member.remarks: "Type" should be replaced with the type of object the command will be executed against.

member.name: T:GrooperGit.Properties.Resources

member.name: P:GrooperGit.Properties.Resources.Culture
